issue.title: Upgrade to Webswing 2.4

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
The Docker images currently include webswing 2.3
Webswing 2.4 has been released: http://webswing.org/#!/downloads
Upgrading should be easy but testing will be required :)

- https://github.com/zaproxy/zaproxy/blob/develop/build/docker/Dockerfile-stable#L54
- https://github.com/zaproxy/zaproxy/blob/develop/build/docker/Dockerfile-weekly#L55
- https://github.com/zaproxy/zaproxy/blob/develop/build/docker/Dockerfile-live#L71

body:
Having the same issue here, made difficult the configuration of ZAP API for me. I tried for example to add a Whitelisted ip to the API but the 2nd level contextual pop-up is not reachable.
I had the same StackTrace as the one reported on the first issue listed by @thc202 (https://bitbucket.org/meszarv/webswing/issues/97).

I see @psiinon and @flibustier have been working on the webswing startup script, could you guys fix it or let me know how you would fix it (I can help if you don't have time)

There's no release yet that have both issues fixed. We could use a dev build but that might have its issues too.

@psiinon what do you think, should we use a dev build in the meantime?

issue.title: owasp/zap2docker-weekly Webswing Interface / Create Users Context (Add User) Not Working

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
Pulled the weekly ZAP Docker tonight, using the Webswing interface.

Set up a custom context with forms-based authentication for authenticated scanning and spidering, but when I go to the Users tab to create a user to populate the Login Request POST Data with, the Add button does not work.

body: So can these second level Swing menus be configured via the REST API with Python? If not, it would seem that the utility of Docker ZAP is pretty limited currently.

issue.title: owasp/zap2docker-weekly Webswing Interface / Fuzzer Doesn't Work

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
Pulled the most recent Docker weekly image tonight, Webswing interface.

Right click -> Attack -> Fuzz does not work, nor does Menu -> Tools -> Fuzz

Is the weekly image so bleeding edge that lots of functionality isn't working? Should I be using a more conservative image instead of weekly builds?

body:
Depends on the exact functionality, re #4227, yes, contexts can be configured through the API (Python example at [1]).

[1] https://github.com/soprasteria/zap-api-python/blob/4b7e5ddbcac9401549a6bb3c857df46b13f8814a/src/examples/zap_example_api_script.py
Hi, is there any news regarding integrating Webswing 2.5? I hit the brick wall regarding adding users for authentication. Do we know if Webswing 2.5 will address the Java environment issue?
Yes, 2.5 is already released and it fixes the above issues, I have the changes more or less ready but need to try them in the docker image.
Fab, thanks thc202 for the quick reply. I'll pass on the info to my colleague who takes the docker images and packages for use in our environment will be great to get this working.

Hi I'm back again - My colleague has been creating various different combinations of ZAP and webswing to try and come up with a working combination for the entering username and password dialogue issue. He did try to create a 2.7 ZAP with webswing 2.5 build but had problems. So far have to go back to 2.5 ZAP with webswing 2.4 to have a working dialogue box. With ZAP 2.6 and webswing 2.4 only have half the box, no username and password part as per the attachment. Really looking forward to a working 2.7 combo.
![zap add user dialogue part missing](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36737624/36854404-d59df1da-1d68-11e8-9a70-e4eedd27650c.PNG)

issue.title: Update Webswing to 2.5 in Docker images

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
Update Docker build files to download Webswing 2.5, remove its demos,
and use a directory without version for Webswing (less changes required
when updating).
Update Webswing configuration to 2.5, ZAP will now be started/available,
for example, under:
  `http://localhost:8080/zap/`
instead of:
  `http://localhost:8080/?anonym=true&app=ZAP`

ZAP will still be accessed with an anonymous account, no other account
will be available.
Update Webswing start up script, zap-webswing.sh, to use the new  dir
and to not pick the user.properties file, there's none to.

Fix #3553 - Update Webswing in Docker images

body: Thanks for the bump and sorry for the delay, a pull request has been open to update Webswing in all images, #4471.

Hi I'm sorry I'm sure this isn't the correct place to put this now, but I'm not sure on the process of finding relevant thread. Anyway my developer produced a new docker image with 2.7 and 2.5 webswing using the info in the update post. The interface works and I'm able to add the user name and password, but when I go to replay the POST I get a CSRF token is incorrect error as per the attached screenshot. I didn't get this before. Sorry if I missed a new setting in 2.7? 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36737624/36912191-e6ec6842-1e3d-11e8-94b6-6fcd222bea5c.png)

Not that I'm aware of, manual request editor does not handle anti-CSRF tokens automatically (#111), how were you sending the request before? (script?)

Usage questions are usually handled in the OWASP ZAP User Group: https://groups.google.com/group/zaproxy-users

Hi thc202 many thanks for the support. I'm attaching an image of the response for ZAP 2.5. As you can see I'm basically following through the basic tutorial of setting up an attack to DVWA. All I'm doing is right clicking on the login.php POST and choosing the resend option after previously flagging this as a Forms based login. In 2.5 the login is successful and I'm able to mark logged in identification string in the response window. With 2.7 I'm not as I get the CSRF error. 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36737624/36932188-92585f36-1ebd-11e8-920d-1ef133e16e0f.png)
